reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: Expository bottle episodes are as crucial to comics as crossovers. Not every detour is a waste of time.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: Like the young Natasha herself, "Black Widow" feels as though it's been programmed into submission - and scarcely allowed to live and breathe before it's suddenly over.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: The stakes are nonexistent. No matter how many times a bad guy (or girl) aims a gun at our beloved heroine, we know she has a specific Endgame.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: "Black Widow" is a strong solo superhero effort that feels both timely and also way too late.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: At its best... "Black Widow" is a welcome break from the overwrought transmedia machine that dictates Disney's biggest franchise bets, and almost invites you to forget what's at stake.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

reviews.text: Shortland and her writing team have given us a film that is more ingrained in the spy movie genre than the usual superhero fodder.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: Casting is maybe the primary strength of this mega-franchise, and the film's familiar bantering dynamic gets a strong assist from new hires.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: Marvel returns to cinemas, and its first film back is a bit lackluster. This feels ten years too late, not just for the character but for this type of bland action film.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: "Black Widow" is a decent action vehicle and spy thriller, even if it feels a bit paint-by-numbers and years late to the screen.
reviews.author: Kirsten Acuna

reviews.text: While it's hard not to dwell on the fact that Black Widow should have been made a decade ago, the new movie still manages to be a well-placed addition to the franchise and the perfect send-off for Scarlett Johansson and Natasha Romanoff.
reviews.author: Jamie Jirak

reviews.text: Florence Pugh and Scarlet Johansson's relationship is the heart of the story. David Harbour is thoroughly enjoyable. While not a perfect film, it's a bittersweet feeling watching Scarlett's run as Natasha Romanoff coming to a final end in the MCU.
reviews.author: Lupe Rodriguez Haas

reviews.text: Shortland works in unvarnished closeup and establishes a mood of lurching, desultory anxiety that's closer to Russian neorealism than the Russo brothers.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: This action-packed film coupled with some serious emotional family plot points will give Natasha fans what they have been waiting for -- but Florence Pugh steals the show.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: For fans of Black Widow and everyone else, this episode is great fun and Harbour could well ascend to spinoff greatness of his own.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Both a solid spy thriller and an engaging familial drama, it brings the action but wisely offers plenty of heart and humour and leaves you completely satisfied.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: I laughed more than a few times, in the right places, and you will, too. It helps that the four main actors are among the best you can hire.
reviews.author: Roger Friedman

reviews.text: Well-worth the longer than expected wait.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Black Widow might be better late than never but Marvel Studios does it again and delivers the goods.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: BLACK WIDOW will provide some closure for fans, but the film is not without its flaws.
reviews.author: Sarah Musnicky

reviews.text: This standalone proves a stellar vehicle for Scarlett Johansson's Natasha Romanoff, given first-rate support by Florence Pugh, Rachel Weisz and David Harbour.
reviews.author: David Rooney

reviews.text: If ever proof were needed that Natasha could easily carry her own movie, here it arrives fully formed. Better late than never.
reviews.author: Matt Maytum

reviews.text: Its lazy script reduces elements of trauma to empty dialogue ad awkward comedy. A disappointing Marvel movie that fails its fans and casting alike. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ricardo Gallegos

reviews.text: Boiled down to its essence, this narrative isn't terribly hard to follow, but in execution the film moves so haphazardly as to be bewildering.
reviews.author: Jake Cole

reviews.text: It shouldn't really have taken 11 years for the Widow to get her own standalone adventure. But thanks to some zesty new character dynamics and smart twists, Marvel have finally done her right.
reviews.author: Nick De Semlyen

reviews.text: It's just a shame that Natasha never had this from the very start.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: Black Widow falls victim to the big bombast characteristic of the studio. The result is a disappointing solo movie that ends up burying Natasha Romanoff once again.
reviews.author: Hoai-Tran Bui

reviews.text: Some will immediately sniff out "Black Widow" for the glorified side mission, meant to set up an inevitable Disney+ series, that it is but "Black Widow" manages to get the job done, giving the beloved Natasha Romanoff the spotlight she always deserved.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: Black Widow embraces the history of the character-the good and the bad...This core element of the film is what makes it perfect for comic book readers, while the spectacle will satisfy MCU fans who have only ever watched the films.
reviews.author: Kate Sánchez

reviews.text: Johansson is again a great presence in the role, showing expert action and acting chops throughout, while Pugh is clearly ready to lead her own franchise after this MCU debut.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: The film does offer additional insight into the character's tortured past, but the overwhelming effect is that of a baton being passed.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Black Widow is filled with fantastic action-packed sequences, fun comedic beats, and themes of family, even while it shortchanges Natasha herself.
reviews.author: Mae Abdulbaki

reviews.text: An engaging, action-packed spy thriller that combines the high energy of a Jason Bourne movie with the campy intrigue of a Roger Moore-era James Bond film.
reviews.author: Joey Morona

reviews.text: It's more a true end for Phase 3 than a start for Phase 4, but Natasha deserved this movie. (...) It gives her a reason to be, to live and to die. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jesus Agudo

reviews.text: While the film is plied with eye-catching action sequences, it struggles to strike a balance between action and family drama, and reinforces some of Marvel's tired tropes of women superheroes.
reviews.author: Nicole Clark

reviews.text: An ambitious, honest, and messy entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe that succeeds at setting itself apart from the franchise in surprising ways.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: An action-packed and emotional look at Black Widow's past delivers on its premise, but struggles with being so late in Natasha Romanoff's story.
reviews.author: Amelia Emberwing

reviews.text: It's almost a shame that Florence Pugh is so vibrant here, since it takes away from appreciating Scarlett Johansson in likely her last turn as Black Widow.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Divorced of its duties to superhero lore, Black Widow would still be a sufficiently deft spy caper, confidently crafted and worthy on its own terms.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: While it's certainly an odd time to choose to tell this story, that doesn't stop it from being another solid entry in the MCU. The story is smaller, darker, and more personal, and features several standout new characters.
reviews.author: Sean Chandler

reviews.text: 'Black Widow' is Marvel's very own spy blockbuster.
reviews.author: Brian Lloyd

reviews.text: Black Widow is full of action and car chases, but they're balanced by moments of humor, genuine emotion and accompanied by plot twists you won't see coming.
reviews.author: Nicole Ackman

reviews.text: Despite your standard Marvel action set piece and a colorful cast of characters, Black Widow feels of little consequence, delivering a story that has written itself into a corner with nowhere to go.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: Thrilling, clever twists and turns combined with capably constructed and propulsive set pieces make this a film with stamina and staying power.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Black Widow is Bourne meets Bond meets Terminator...with two outstanding, badass female leads. Action-packed, funny, and at times surprisingly gut-wrenching, Cate Shortland's vision for the MCU is bold, empowering, and utterly unmissable.
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: Black Widow is full of action and heart. To my surprise, the movie is at its best during the quiet moments. The theme here is family, and that holds true throughout.
reviews.author: Austin Burke

reviews.text: The chemistry between these two fantastic actors [Scarlett Johansson and Florence Pugh] is stunning, and Pugh is a perfect addition to the MCU.
reviews.author: Jenna Busch

reviews.text: Marvel is more invested in weaving a web of explosions, stunts & violence than our investment in Black Widow's character. Not my favorite solo film.
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text: A far more impressive and enjoyable solo outing than the MCU has produced in recent memory, but it's still mind boggling we didn't get this movie ten years ago.
reviews.author: Dominic Griffin

reviews.text: A solid action picture that does its best not to buckle under the weight of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: This new Marvel movie launches into the espionage and assassin genres with the unblinking verve of a Bourne or a Wick. It's an unexpected form for an Avengers offshoot to take. But that's what makes it work.
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.text: Black Widow is just what a world waking up from a coma needs: a female-centered action extravaganza with exceptional performances, lots of laughs, and just a touch of that Marvel magic that just may be the antidote we've all been waiting for.
reviews.author: Catherine Springer

reviews.text: "Black Widow" is mostly an entertaining and adequate tribute to Natasha Romanoff, Black Widow, and Scarlett Johannson's time in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but it's not very consequential.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: An explosive return to cinematic Marvel! Filled with exhilarating action sequences and enormously touching franchise defining moments, it's the Marvel movie we all need right now! Johansson shines, finally getting the spotlight she's always deserved.
reviews.author: Dave Lee

synopsis: In Marvel Studios' action-packed spy thriller "Black Widow," Natasha Romanoff aka Black Widow confronts the darker parts of her ledger when a dangerous conspiracy with ties to her past arises. Pursued by a force that will stop at nothing to bring her down, Natasha must deal with her history as a spy and the broken relationships left in her wake long before she became an Avenger.
